title: Deck The Halls With These Christmas Centerpiece Ideas
description: The holiday season is upon us, and it’s time to deck the halls with festive cheer! One of the best ways to add a touch of Christmas magic to your home is through stunning centerpieces. author: Sherry Nothingam
excerpt: Discover 25 festive DIY Christmas centerpiece ideas to add holiday cheer to your home. From rustic to glamorous, find the perfect centerpiece for your table or mantel this season.
text: The holiday season is upon us, and it’s time to deck the halls with festive cheer! One of the best ways to add a touch of Christmas magic to your home is through stunning centerpieces. Whether you’re looking to spruce up your dining table, mantel, or coffee table, we’ve got you covered with 20 creative DIY Christmas centerpiece ideas that will make your space merry and bright. Let’s dive in and explore these jolly creations that are sure to impress your holiday guests! 1. Hang Ornaments From Wooden Frame Photo Credit: Pinterest Transform old picture frames into festive ornament displays for a unique centerpiece. Start by painting the frame in a holiday color or leaving it natural for a rustic look. Attach twine or ribbon across the frame to create a grid for hanging ornaments. Choose a variety of ornaments in different sizes, colors, and textures to create visual interest. Add some greenery, pinecones, or fairy lights to complete the look. This versatile centerpiece can be customized to match any holiday decor style. 2. Spray New Life into Mini Christmas Trees Photo Credit: Pinterest Give new life to artificial mini Christmas trees by spray painting them in unexpected colors. Choose metallic shades like gold or silver for a glamorous look, or opt for pastels for a whimsical touch. Arrange the trees in varying heights for added dimension. Decorate the trees with small ornaments, ribbons, or tinsel to enhance their festive appeal. Place them in decorative pots or wrap the bases in burlap for a rustic feel. Group several trees together for an eye-catching centerpiece that will brighten any space. 3. Craft Snowmen Candles for the Table Photo Credit: Pinterest Create adorable snowman candles for a charming table centerpiece. Use white pillar candles as the base and decorate them with felt or fabric to create scarves and hats. Use buttons or small beads for the eyes and nose. Arrange the snowmen candles on a mirrored tray or a bed of faux snow for a wintry scene. Add some miniature trees, pinecones, or glittery snowflakes to complete the display. This cute and cozy centerpiece will bring smiles to everyone gathered around the table. 4. Cake Stands to Create Winter Wonderlands Photo Credit: Pinterest Repurpose cake stands to create enchanting winter wonderland scenes. Start with a tiered cake stand and fill each level with miniature Christmas village houses, trees, and figurines. Use cotton batting or artificial snow to create a snowy landscape. Add twinkling LED lights to bring the scene to life and create a magical glow. Incorporate small mirrors to represent icy ponds, or sprinkle some glitter for extra sparkle. This whimsical centerpiece will captivate both children and adults alike. 5. Rainbow Bottle Brush Christmas Trees Photo Credit: Pinterest Bring a pop of color to your holiday decor with rainbow bottle brush trees. Collect bottle brush trees in various sizes and dye them in vibrant hues using fabric dye or food coloring. Arrange them in a rainbow gradient for a cheerful display. Place the colorful trees on a silver or gold tray for added elegance. Intersperse some glittery ornaments or small presents between the trees for extra festive flair. This modern twist on traditional Christmas decor is sure to be a conversation starter. 6. Festive Mason Jar Candles Photo Credit: Pinterest Create a warm and cozy ambiance with DIY mason jar candles. Paint the jars in festive colors or leave them clear for a rustic look. Fill the jars with Epsom salt or artificial snow and nestle a pillar candle inside. Tie ribbons or twine around the jar rims and add decorative elements like pine sprigs, cinnamon sticks, or small ornaments. Group several jars together for a stunning centerpiece that will cast a soft, flickering glow across your holiday table. 7. Dessert Trays for Tiered Centerpieces Photo Credit: Pinterest Repurpose tiered dessert trays to create stunning Christmas centerpieces. Start with a multi-level tray and fill each tier with an assortment of holiday decorations. Use ornaments, pinecones, candles, and greenery to create a layered look. Incorporate different textures and materials for visual interest. Add some battery-operated fairy lights to make the display sparkle. This versatile centerpiece can be easily customized to match your holiday color scheme and decor style. 8. Beverage Glasses Make Great Decorations Photo Credit: Pinterest Turn ordinary drinking glasses into festive decorations for your centerpiece. Fill various sizes of glasses with colorful ornaments, pinecones, or artificial snow. Add battery-operated tea lights for a warm glow. Arrange the filled glasses on a decorative tray or charger plate. Intersperse some greenery or ribbon between the glasses for added texture. This simple yet elegant centerpiece is perfect for those who want a quick and easy holiday decoration. 9. Edible Trees and Ornaments Photo Credit: Pinterest Using edible elements, create a delicious and eye-catching centerpiece. Stack cookies or brownies in a tree shape and decorate with colorful candies and icing. Use candy canes as the tree trunk for an extra festive touch. Surround the edible tree with chocolate truffles shaped like ornaments or small fruit arrangements. This tasty centerpiece will not only look great but will also serve as a sweet treat for your guests after the meal. 10. Decorate Wine Bottles to Add Ambience Photo Credit: Pinterest Upcycle empty wine bottles into stunning holiday decorations. Remove the labels and paint the bottles in festive colors or leave them clear. Fill the bottles with fairy lights for a magical glow. Decorate the bottles with ribbon, twine, or glitter. Group several bottles together and add some greenery or pinecones around the base. This eco-friendly centerpiece is perfect for wine lovers and adds a touch of sophistication to your holiday table. 11. Fruity Centerpieces Photo Credit: Pinterest Incorporate fresh fruit into your centerpiece for a natural and colorful display. Arrange citrus fruits like oranges, lemons, and limes in a large bowl or on a cake stand. Add some evergreen sprigs and pinecones for a festive touch. Create a fruit topiary by stacking apples or pears and securing them with toothpicks. Decorate with cinnamon sticks and star anise for a fragrant addition. This fresh and vibrant centerpiece will add a pop of color to your holiday table. 12. Decorate and Fill Wicker Baskets Photo Credit: Pinterest Transform wicker baskets into charming Christmas centerpieces. Fill a basket with an assortment of ornaments, pinecones, and greenery. Add some battery-operated candles for a warm glow. Tie a festive ribbon around the basket handle and add some sprigs of holly or berries. This rustic centerpiece is perfect for farmhouse-style decor and can be easily customized to fit your color scheme. 13. Table Runners and String Lights Photo Credit: Pinterest Create a stunning tablescape using a festive table runner and string lights. Choose a runner in a holiday pattern or color and lay it down in the center of your table. Weave battery-operated string lights along the length of the runner. Add candles, ornaments, and greenery along the runner to create a magical display. This simple yet effective centerpiece will transform your entire table into a festive wonderland. 14. Hollow Out Logs for Candles Photo Credit: Pinterest Bring a touch of nature to your centerpiece with hollowed-out logs. Use a drill to create holes in a log or branch for tea lights or pillar candles. Sand the edges for a smooth finish. Arrange the log on a bed of evergreen branches and add some pinecones or berries. This rustic centerpiece is perfect for a woodland-themed Christmas decor and adds a cozy, cabin-like feel to your space. 15. Step Up Your Bowl Game Photo Credit: Pinterest Create a simple yet elegant centerpiece using a large bowl filled with ornaments. Choose a clear glass or metallic bowl and fill it with an assortment of ornaments in complementary colors. Mix different sizes and finishes for added interest. Add some greenery or tinsel around the edges of the bowl for a festive touch. This quick and easy centerpiece can be customized to match any color scheme and is perfect for last-minute decorating. 16. Fill Lanterns with Christmas Decorations Photo Credit: Pinterest Repurpose outdoor lanterns as festive indoor centerpieces. Fill lanterns with an assortment of ornaments, pinecones, and battery-operated candles. For extra flair, add greenery or ribbon to the top of the lantern. Group several lanterns of different sizes together for a stunning display. This versatile centerpiece works well on tables, mantels, or even as part of a larger holiday vignette. 17. Silver and Gold Add a Festive Glitz Photo Credit: Pinterest Create a glamorous centerpiece using silver and gold elements. Fill glass vases or bowls with metallic ornaments, beads, and tinsel. Add some glittery branches or sprays for height and texture. Incorporate mercury glass candle holders or metallic pillar candles for added sparkle. This elegant centerpiece is perfect for New Year’s Eve celebrations or for those who prefer a more sophisticated holiday look. 18. Balance Some Presents Photo Credit: Pinterest Create a playful centerpiece using wrapped gift boxes. Stack presents of various sizes and wrap them in coordinating papers. Use ribbon and bows to add extra decoration. Arrange the stacked presents on a cake stand or charger plate. Add some small ornaments or greenery around the base for a finishing touch. This fun centerpiece adds a whimsical element to your holiday decor. 19. Christmas Character-Themed Centerpieces Photo Credit: Pinterest Bring beloved holiday characters to life in your centerpiece. Create a scene featuring Santa, reindeer, snowmen, or elves using figurines or DIY elements. Use a shallow tray or wooden box as the base for your display. Add artificial snow, miniature trees, and tiny wrapped presents to complete the scene. This charming centerpiece is sure to delight both children and adults and can become a cherished holiday tradition. 20. Dust Off and Paint Forgotten Souvenirs Photo Credit: Pinterest Incorporate old souvenirs into a unique centerpiece to give them new life. Paint small figurines or knickknacks in festive colors like red, green, or gold and arrange them on a mirrored tray or cake stand. Add some greenery, pinecones, or ornaments to fill in the gaps. This personalized centerpiece is a great way to showcase your travels or family memories while adding a festive touch to your decor.

The holiday season is upon us, and it’s time to deck the halls with festive cheer! One of the best ways to add a touch of Christmas magic to your home is through stunning centerpieces. Whether you’re looking to spruce up your dining table, mantel, or coffee table, we’ve got you covered with 20 creative DIY Christmas centerpiece ideas that will make your space merry and bright. Let’s dive in and explore these jolly creations that are sure to impress your holiday guests!

1. Hang Ornaments From Wooden Frame

Transform old picture frames into festive ornament displays for a unique centerpiece. Start by painting the frame in a holiday color or leaving it natural for a rustic look. Attach twine or ribbon across the frame to create a grid for hanging ornaments.

Choose a variety of ornaments in different sizes, colors, and textures to create visual interest. Add some greenery, pinecones, or fairy lights to complete the look. This versatile centerpiece can be customized to match any holiday decor style.

2. Spray New Life into Mini Christmas Trees

Give new life to artificial mini Christmas trees by spray painting them in unexpected colors. Choose metallic shades like gold or silver for a glamorous look, or opt for pastels for a whimsical touch. Arrange the trees in varying heights for added dimension.

Decorate the trees with small ornaments, ribbons, or tinsel to enhance their festive appeal. Place them in decorative pots or wrap the bases in burlap for a rustic feel. Group several trees together for an eye-catching centerpiece that will brighten any space.

3. Craft Snowmen Candles for the Table

Create adorable snowman candles for a charming table centerpiece. Use white pillar candles as the base and decorate them with felt or fabric to create scarves and hats. Use buttons or small beads for the eyes and nose.

Arrange the snowmen candles on a mirrored tray or a bed of faux snow for a wintry scene. Add some miniature trees, pinecones, or glittery snowflakes to complete the display. This cute and cozy centerpiece will bring smiles to everyone gathered around the table.

4. Cake Stands to Create Winter Wonderlands

Repurpose cake stands to create enchanting winter wonderland scenes. Start with a tiered cake stand and fill each level with miniature Christmas village houses, trees, and figurines. Use cotton batting or artificial snow to create a snowy landscape.

Add twinkling LED lights to bring the scene to life and create a magical glow. Incorporate small mirrors to represent icy ponds, or sprinkle some glitter for extra sparkle. This whimsical centerpiece will captivate both children and adults alike.

5. Rainbow Bottle Brush Christmas Trees

Bring a pop of color to your holiday decor with rainbow bottle brush trees. Collect bottle brush trees in various sizes and dye them in vibrant hues using fabric dye or food coloring. Arrange them in a rainbow gradient for a cheerful display.

Place the colorful trees on a silver or gold tray for added elegance. Intersperse some glittery ornaments or small presents between the trees for extra festive flair. This modern twist on traditional Christmas decor is sure to be a conversation starter.

6. Festive Mason Jar Candles

Create a warm and cozy ambiance with DIY mason jar candles. Paint the jars in festive colors or leave them clear for a rustic look. Fill the jars with Epsom salt or artificial snow and nestle a pillar candle inside.

Tie ribbons or twine around the jar rims and add decorative elements like pine sprigs, cinnamon sticks, or small ornaments. Group several jars together for a stunning centerpiece that will cast a soft, flickering glow across your holiday table.

7. Dessert Trays for Tiered Centerpieces

Repurpose tiered dessert trays to create stunning Christmas centerpieces. Start with a multi-level tray and fill each tier with an assortment of holiday decorations. Use ornaments, pinecones, candles, and greenery to create a layered look.

Incorporate different textures and materials for visual interest. Add some battery-operated fairy lights to make the display sparkle. This versatile centerpiece can be easily customized to match your holiday color scheme and decor style.

8. Beverage Glasses Make Great Decorations

Turn ordinary drinking glasses into festive decorations for your centerpiece. Fill various sizes of glasses with colorful ornaments, pinecones, or artificial snow. Add battery-operated tea lights for a warm glow.

Arrange the filled glasses on a decorative tray or charger plate. Intersperse some greenery or ribbon between the glasses for added texture. This simple yet elegant centerpiece is perfect for those who want a quick and easy holiday decoration.

9. Edible Trees and Ornaments

Using edible elements, create a delicious and eye-catching centerpiece. Stack cookies or brownies in a tree shape and decorate with colorful candies and icing. Use candy canes as the tree trunk for an extra festive touch.

Surround the edible tree with chocolate truffles shaped like ornaments or small fruit arrangements. This tasty centerpiece will not only look great but will also serve as a sweet treat for your guests after the meal.

10. Decorate Wine Bottles to Add Ambience

Upcycle empty wine bottles into stunning holiday decorations. Remove the labels and paint the bottles in festive colors or leave them clear. Fill the bottles with fairy lights for a magical glow.

Decorate the bottles with ribbon, twine, or glitter. Group several bottles together and add some greenery or pinecones around the base. This eco-friendly centerpiece is perfect for wine lovers and adds a touch of sophistication to your holiday table.

11. Fruity Centerpieces

Incorporate fresh fruit into your centerpiece for a natural and colorful display. Arrange citrus fruits like oranges, lemons, and limes in a large bowl or on a cake stand. Add some evergreen sprigs and pinecones for a festive touch.

Create a fruit topiary by stacking apples or pears and securing them with toothpicks. Decorate with cinnamon sticks and star anise for a fragrant addition. This fresh and vibrant centerpiece will add a pop of color to your holiday table.

12. Decorate and Fill Wicker Baskets

Transform wicker baskets into charming Christmas centerpieces. Fill a basket with an assortment of ornaments, pinecones, and greenery. Add some battery-operated candles for a warm glow.

Tie a festive ribbon around the basket handle and add some sprigs of holly or berries. This rustic centerpiece is perfect for farmhouse-style decor and can be easily customized to fit your color scheme.

13. Table Runners and String Lights

Create a stunning tablescape using a festive table runner and string lights. Choose a runner in a holiday pattern or color and lay it down in the center of your table. Weave battery-operated string lights along the length of the runner.

Add candles, ornaments, and greenery along the runner to create a magical display. This simple yet effective centerpiece will transform your entire table into a festive wonderland.

14. Hollow Out Logs for Candles

Bring a touch of nature to your centerpiece with hollowed-out logs. Use a drill to create holes in a log or branch for tea lights or pillar candles. Sand the edges for a smooth finish.

Arrange the log on a bed of evergreen branches and add some pinecones or berries. This rustic centerpiece is perfect for a woodland-themed Christmas decor and adds a cozy, cabin-like feel to your space.

Add some greenery or tinsel around the edges of the bowl for a festive touch. This quick and easy centerpiece can be customized to match any color scheme and is perfect for last-minute decorating.

16. Fill Lanterns with Christmas Decorations

Repurpose outdoor lanterns as festive indoor centerpieces. Fill lanterns with an assortment of ornaments, pinecones, and battery-operated candles. For extra flair, add greenery or ribbon to the top of the lantern.

Group several lanterns of different sizes together for a stunning display. This versatile centerpiece works well on tables, mantels, or even as part of a larger holiday vignette.

17. Silver and Gold Add a Festive Glitz

Create a glamorous centerpiece using silver and gold elements. Fill glass vases or bowls with metallic ornaments, beads, and tinsel. Add some glittery branches or sprays for height and texture.

Incorporate mercury glass candle holders or metallic pillar candles for added sparkle. This elegant centerpiece is perfect for New Year’s Eve celebrations or for those who prefer a more sophisticated holiday look.

18. Balance Some Presents

Create a playful centerpiece using wrapped gift boxes. Stack presents of various sizes and wrap them in coordinating papers. Use ribbon and bows to add extra decoration.

Arrange the stacked presents on a cake stand or charger plate. Add some small ornaments or greenery around the base for a finishing touch. This fun centerpiece adds a whimsical element to your holiday decor.

19. Christmas Character-Themed Centerpieces

Bring beloved holiday characters to life in your centerpiece. Create a scene featuring Santa, reindeer, snowmen, or elves using figurines or DIY elements. Use a shallow tray or wooden box as the base for your display.

Add artificial snow, miniature trees, and tiny wrapped presents to complete the scene. This charming centerpiece is sure to delight both children and adults and can become a cherished holiday tradition.

20. Dust Off and Paint Forgotten Souvenirs

Incorporate old souvenirs into a unique centerpiece to give them new life. Paint small figurines or knickknacks in festive colors like red, green, or gold and arrange them on a mirrored tray or cake stand.

Add some greenery, pinecones, or ornaments to fill in the gaps. This personalized centerpiece is a great way to showcase your travels or family memories while adding a festive touch to your decor.
